SERVO_BLH_3DMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

SERVO_BLH_AUTO.Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors
SERVO_BLH_AUTO.DisplayName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors

SERVO_BLH_BDMASK.Description: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.
SERVO_BLH_BDMASK.DisplayName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels

SERVO_BLH_DEBUG.Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

SERVO_BLH_MASK.Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

SERVO_BLH_OTYPE.Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

SERVO_BLH_POLES.Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

SERVO_BLH_PORT.Description: This sets the mavlink channel to use for blheli pass-thru. The channel number is determined by the number of serial ports configured to use mavlink. So 0 is always the console, 1 is the next serial port using mavlink, 2 the next after that and so on.

SERVO_BLH_RVMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

SERVO_BLH_TEST.Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

SERVO_BLH_TMOUT.Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

SERVO_BLH_TRATE.Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

SERVO_FTW_MASK.Description: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

SERVO_FTW_RVMASK.Description: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

SERVO_ROB_POSMAX.Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_ROB_POSMIN.Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_SBUS_RATE.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

SERVO_VOLZ_MASK.Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

SIM_ACC1_SCAL_X.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (X-axis)

SIM_ACC1_SCAL_Y.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Y-axis)

SIM_ACC1_SCAL_Z.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Z-axis)

SIM_ACC2_SCAL_X.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (X-axis)

SIM_ACC2_SCAL_Y.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Y-axis)

SIM_ACC2_SCAL_Z.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Z-axis)

SIM_ACC3_SCAL_X.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (X-axis)

SIM_ACC3_SCAL_Y.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Y-axis)

SIM_ACC3_SCAL_Z.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Z-axis)

SIM_ACC4_SCAL_X.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (X-axis)

SIM_ACC4_SCAL_Y.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Y-axis)

SIM_ACC4_SCAL_Z.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Z-axis)

SIM_ACC5_SCAL_X.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (X-axis)

SIM_ACC5_SCAL_Y.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Y-axis)

SIM_ACC5_SCAL_Z.Description: scaling factors applied to simulated accelerometer (Z-axis)

SIM_ACC_FAIL_MSK.Description: Determines if the acclerometer reading updates are stopped when for an IMU simulated failure by ACCELx_FAIL params

SIM_ADSB_TYPES.Description: specifies which simulated ADSB types are active

SIM_BAR2_RND.Description: Amount of (evenly-distributed) noise injected into the 2nd baro

SIM_BAR3_RND.Description: Amount of (evenly-distributed) noise injected into the 3rd baro

SIM_BARO_RND.Description: Amount of (evenly-distributed) noise injected into the 1st baro

SIM_CAN_SRV_MSK.Description: The set of actuators controlled externally by CAN SITL AP_Periph

SIM_CAN_TYPE1.Description: transport type for first CAN interface
SIM_CAN_TYPE1.DisplayName: transport type for first CAN interface

SIM_CAN_TYPE2.Description: transport type for second CAN interface
SIM_CAN_TYPE2.DisplayName: transport type for second CAN interface

SIM_FLOAT_EXCEPT.Description: If set, if a numerical error occurs SITL will die with a floating point exception.

SIM_INIT_ALT_OFS.Description: GPS initial alt offset from origin

SIM_INIT_LAT_OFS.Description: GPS initial lat offset from origin

SIM_INIT_LON_OFS.Description: GPS initial lon offset from origin

SIM_JSON_MASTER.Description: the instance number to  take servos from

SIM_MAG_SAVE_IDS.Description: This forces saving of compass devids on startup so that simulated compasses start as calibrated

SIM_OH_MASK.Description: channels which are passed through to actual hardware when running sim on actual hardware

SIM_OH_RELAY_MSK.Description: Allow relay output operation when running SIM-on-hardware

SIM_RC_FAIL.Description: Allows you to emulate rc failures in sim

Values.2: All Channels neutral except Throttle is 950us

SIM_SPEEDUP.Description: Runs the simulation at multiples of normal speed. Do not use if realtime physics, like RealFlight, is being used

SIM_UART_LOSS.Description: Sets percentage of outgoing byte loss on UARTs

SIM_WIND_DIR.Description: Allows you to set wind direction (true deg) in sim

SIM_WIND_SPD.Description: Allows you to emulate wind in sim

SIM_WIND_TURB.Description: Allows you to emulate random wind variations in sim

SIM_WIND_T_.Description: Selects how wind varies from surface to WIND_T_ALT

SIM_WIND_T_ALT.Description: Altitude at which wind reaches full strength, decaying from full strength as altitude lowers to ground level

SIM_WIND_T_COEF.Description: For linear wind profile,wind is reduced by (Altitude-WIND_T_ALT) x this value

SIM_WOW_PIN.Description: SITL set this simulated pin to true if vehicle is on ground

SIM_ARSPD2_PITOT.Description: Simulated airspeed sensor pitot tube failure pressure

SIM_ARSPD2_SIGN.Description: Simulated airspeed sensor with reversed pitot/static connections

SIM_ARSPD_PITOT.Description: Simulated airspeed sensor pitot tube failure pressure

SIM_ARSPD_SIGN.Description: Simulated airspeed sensor with reversed pitot/static connections

SIM_GRPE_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPE_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper emp is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPS_GRAB.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

SIM_GRPS_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_RELEASE.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to release the cargo

SIM_PLD_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Preland simulation

SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.Description: Precland device center's height above sealevel assume a 2x2m square as station base
SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.DisplayName: Precland device center's height above sealevel

SIM_PLD_RATE.Description: Precland device rate. e.g led patter refresh rate, RF message rate, etc.

SIM_PLD_TYPE.Description: Precland device radiance type: it can be a cylinder, a cone, or a sphere.

SIM_PLD_YAW.Description: Precland device systems rotation from north
SIM_PLD_YAW.DisplayName: Precland device systems rotation from north

SIM_SPR_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Sprayer simulation

SIM_SPR_PUMP.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer pump is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_SPR_SPIN.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer spinner servo is connected to. (start at 1)

STAT_BOOTCNT.Description: Number of times board has been booted

STAT_RESET.Description: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

ACRO_BAL_PITCH.Description: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode.  A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

ACRO_BAL_ROLL.Description: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode.  A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

ACRO_EXPO.Description: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

ACRO_RP_P.Description: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode.  Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.
ACRO_RP_P.DisplayName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain

ACRO_TRAINER.Description: Type of trainer used in acro mode

ACRO_YAW_P.Description: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation.  Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

FORMAT_VERSION.Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

FRAME_CONFIG.Description: Set this parameter according to your vehicle/motor configuration

FS_CRASH_CHECK.Description: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

FS_EKF_ACTION.Description: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

FS_EKF_THRESH.Description: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

FS_GCS_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action to take when GCS heartbeat is lost.

FS_LEAK_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action to take if a leak is detected.

FS_PILOT_INPUT.Description: Controls what action to take if no pilot input has been received after the timeout period specified by the FS_PILOT_TIMEOUT parameter

FS_PILOT_TIMEOUT.Description: Controls the maximum interval between received pilot inputs before the failsafe action is triggered
FS_PILOT_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: Timeout for activation of pilot input failsafe

FS_PRESS_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action to take if internal pressure exceeds FS_PRESS_MAX parameter.

FS_PRESS_MAX.Description: The maximum internal pressure allowed before triggering failsafe. Failsafe action is determined by FS_PRESS_ENABLE parameter

FS_TEMP_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action to take if internal temperature exceeds FS_TEMP_MAX parameter.

FS_TEMP_MAX.Description: The maximum internal temperature allowed before triggering failsafe. Failsafe action is determined by FS_TEMP_ENABLE parameter.

FS_TERRAIN_ENAB.Description: Controls what action to take if terrain information is lost during AUTO mode

GCS_PID_MASK.Description: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

JS_GAIN_DEFAULT.Description: Default gain at boot, must be in range [JS_GAIN_MIN , JS_GAIN_MAX]. Current gain value is accessible via NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT MAVLink message with name 'PilotGain'.

JS_GAIN_STEPS.Description: Controls the number of steps between minimum and maximum joystick gain when the gain is adjusted using buttons. Set to 1 to always use JS_GAIN_DEFAULT.

JS_LIGHTS_STEPS.Description: Number of steps in brightness between minimum and maximum brightness

JS_THR_GAIN.Description: Scalar for gain on the throttle channel. Gets scaled with the current JS gain

LOG_BITMASK.Description: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

PILOT_ACCEL_Z.Description: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

PILOT_SPEED_DN.Description: The maximum vertical descending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

PILOT_SPEED_UP.Description: The maximum vertical ascending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

PILOT_THR_FILT.Description: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

RC_SPEED.Description: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

RNGFND_SQ_MIN.Description: Minimum signal quality for good rangefinder readings

SURFACE_DEPTH.Description: The depth the external pressure sensor will read when the vehicle is considered at the surface (in centimeters)

SURFTRAK_DEPTH.Description: Minimum depth to engage SURFTRAK mode

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

SYSID_THISMAV.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network
SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle

THR_DZ.Description: The PWM deadzone in microseconds above and below mid throttle. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR.Description: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL

XTRACK_ANG_LIM.Description: Maximum allowed angle (in degrees) between current track and desired heading during waypoint navigation

TEMP1_A0.Description: a0 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP1_A1.Description: a1 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP1_A2.Description: a2 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP1_A3.Description: a3 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP1_A4.Description: a4 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP1_ADDR.Description: Temperature sensor address, typically used for I2C address

TEMP1_BUS.Description: Temperature sensor bus number, typically used to select from multiple I2C buses

TEMP1_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for temprature monitoring.
TEMP1_PIN.DisplayName: Temperature sensor analog voltage sensing pin

TEMP1_SRC.Description: Sensor Source is used to designate which device's temperature report will be replaced by this temperature sensor's data. If 0 (None) then the data is only available via log. In the future a new Motor temperature report will be created for returning data directly.

TEMP1_SRC_ID.Description: Sensor Source Identification is used to replace a specific instance of a system component's temperature report with the temp sensor's. Examples: TEMP_SRC = 1 (ESC), TEMP_SRC_ID = 1 will set the temp of ESC1. TEMP_SRC = 3 (BatteryIndex),TEMP_SRC_ID = 2 will set the temp of BATT2. TEMP_SRC = 4 (BatteryId/SerialNum),TEMP_SRC_ID=42 will set the temp of all batteries that have param BATTn_SERIAL = 42.

TEMP2_A0.Description: a0 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP2_A1.Description: a1 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP2_A2.Description: a2 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP2_A3.Description: a3 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP2_A4.Description: a4 in polynomial of form temperature in deg = a0 + a1*voltage + a2*voltage^2 + a3*voltage^3 + a4*voltage^4

TEMP2_ADDR.Description: Temperature sensor address, typically used for I2C address

TEMP2_BUS.Description: Temperature sensor bus number, typically used to select from multiple I2C buses

TEMP2_PIN.Description: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for temprature monitoring.
TEMP2_PIN.DisplayName: Temperature sensor analog voltage sensing pin

TEMP2_SRC.Description: Sensor Source is used to designate which device's temperature report will be replaced by this temperature sensor's data. If 0 (None) then the data is only available via log. In the future a new Motor temperature report will be created for returning data directly.

TEMP2_SRC_ID.Description: Sensor Source Identification is used to replace a specific instance of a system component's temperature report with the temp sensor's. Examples: TEMP_SRC = 1 (ESC), TEMP_SRC_ID = 1 will set the temp of ESC1. TEMP_SRC = 3 (BatteryIndex),TEMP_SRC_ID = 2 will set the temp of BATT2. TEMP_SRC = 4 (BatteryId/SerialNum),TEMP_SRC_ID=42 will set the temp of all batteries that have param BATTn_SERIAL = 42.

TERRAIN_ENABLE.Description: enable terrain data. This enables the vehicle storing a database of terrain data on the SD card. The terrain data is requested from the ground station as needed, and stored for later use on the SD card. To be useful the ground station must support TERRAIN_REQUEST messages and have access to a terrain database, such as the SRTM database.

TERRAIN_MARGIN.Description: Margin in centi-meters to accept terrain data from the GCS. This can be used to allow older terrain data generated with less accurate latitude/longitude scaling to be used

TERRAIN_OFS_MAX.Description: The maximum adjustment of terrain altitude based on the assumption that the vehicle is on the ground when it is armed. When the vehicle is armed the location of the vehicle is recorded, and when terrain data is available for that location a height adjustment for terrain data is calculated that aligns the terrain height at that location with the altitude recorded at arming. This height adjustment is applied to all terrain data. This parameter clamps the amount of adjustment. A value of zero disables the use of terrain height adjustment.

TERRAIN_OPTIONS.Description: Options to change behaviour of terrain system

TERRAIN_SPACING.Description: Distance between terrain grid points in meters. This controls the horizontal resolution of the terrain data that is stored on te SD card and requested from the ground station. If your GCS is using the ArduPilot SRTM database like Mission Planner or MAVProxy, then a resolution of 100 meters is appropriate. Grid spacings lower than 100 meters waste SD card space if the GCS cannot provide that resolution. The grid spacing also controls how much data is kept in memory during flight. A larger grid spacing will allow for a larger amount of data in memory. A grid spacing of 100 meters results in the vehicle keeping 12 grid squares in memory with each grid square having a size of 2.7 kilometers by 3.2 kilometers. Any additional grid squares are stored on the SD once they are fetched from the GCS and will be loaded as needed.

VISO_DELAY_MS.Description: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

VISO_POS_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

VISO_POS_X.Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.
VISO_POS_X.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera X position offset

VISO_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.
VISO_POS_Y.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset

VISO_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.
VISO_POS_Z.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset

VISO_SCALE.Description: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

VISO_VEL_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

VISO_YAW_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

VTX_ENABLE.Description: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off
VTX_ENABLE.DisplayName: Is the Video Transmitter enabled or not

VTX_FREQ.Description: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

VTX_MAX_POWER.Description: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.

Bitmask.4: Add leading zero byte to requests
Bitmask.7: Ignore status updates in CRSF and blindly set VTX options

VTX_OPTIONS.Description: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels. One stop-bit may be required for VTXs that erroneously mimic iNav behaviour.

VTX_POWER.Description: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level

WPNAV_ACCEL.Description: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

WPNAV_ACCEL_C.Description: Defines the maximum cornering acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions.  If zero uses 2x accel value.

WPNAV_ACCEL_Z.Description: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

WPNAV_JERK.Description: Defines the horizontal jerk in m/s/s used during missions

WPNAV_RADIUS.Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

WPNAV_RFND_USE.Description: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following
WPNAV_RFND_USE.DisplayName: Waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

WPNAV_SPEED.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

WPNAV_SPEED_DN.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

WPNAV_SPEED_UP.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

WPNAV_TER_MARGIN.Description: Waypoint Terrain following altitude margin.  Vehicle will stop if distance from target altitude is larger than this margin (in meters)
